Kamareddy floods: Homes, hopes and harvests swept away in deluge of a lifetime
description: The Ganesh Chaturthi festival brought not cheer but chaos as record rains turned Kamareddy into a disaster zone. Colonies were submerged, vehicles washed away, crops destroyed and hundreds forced to seek shelter on rooftops and relief camps. In three days, the district received 39.98 cm of rainfall — 40.7% of its annual average. P. Laxma Reddy reports from the worst-hit areas

description: Being high up in the Himalayas, in a largely unpopulated area, the India-China border has been largely indeterminate and inaccurate. While at present peace and tranquillity at the boundary is what is important, the issue is far from being resolved

title: Esports star rises in football-crazy Manipur, home to women Olympic medallists
Six in 24 hrs: Series of earthquakes hit Afghanistan; days after quake killed over 2,000
description: A series of earthquakes, including a 5.2 magnitude tremor, have struck Afghanistan's Hindukush region, causing widespread devastation. The quakes have resulted in over 2,200 fatalities and 3,000 injuries, exacerbating an already dire humanitarian situation worsened by recent flash floods. International aid is being mobilized, with the WFP dispatching emergency supplies and India airlifting relief materials to assist affected communities.

title: Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai and more: Trump hosts White House dinner; Musk absent
description: US president Trump hosted tech leaders, including Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerberg, at the White House to discuss AI and US investments. The meeting highlighted the growing influence of Indian-American executives in Silicon Valley. Trump downplayed jobs data, mentioned speaking with Putin, and Google's CEO expressed relief over the antitrust case's end.

description: The gut-brain axis offers a compelling lens through which to interrogate the mental health crisis in India, revealing the hidden costs of antibiotic overuse in the erosion of emotional resilience and cognitive vitality. As India strides towards a more enlightened discourse on mental health, it must not overlook the microbial foundations of wellbeing

description: Lionel Messi marked a potentially final World Cup qualifier on home soil with a goal, leading Argentina to a 3-0 victory over Venezuela. The emotional match at Ms Monumental stadium saw tributes to Messi, with fans celebrating his illustrious career. Youngster Franco Mastantuono also impressed in his first international start, while Messi's two goals highlighted Argentina's dominance.

Axis Capital favors Interglobe Aviation due to its market lead and stable yields. Emkay Global recommends Karur Vysya Bank, citing its strong asset quality and growth potential, despite recent price corrections.

'Kissing bug': Rare and deadly Chagas disease spreading across US
description: Chagas disease, transmitted by kissing bugs, is quietly spreading across the US, now confirmed in over 30 states. Early detection is crucial as the parasitic infection can lead to severe heart and digestive issues, often remaining unnoticed for years. Public health officials urge preventative measures and increased awareness among physicians to combat this rising threat.

title: Himachal rain fury: Landslip in Kullu leaves 1 dead, 6 buried
description: A total of 1,212 roads are closed in Himachal Pradesh, of which 289 were blocked in Mandi, 231 in Kullu, 211 in Shimla, 192 in Chamba district

description: When confronted with the possibility that making the name change would require an act of Congress, Mr. Trump told reporters that “we're just going to do it".

Shock comeback! Cricket legend, 41, ends retirement to play for Samoa
description: Ross Taylor, the former New Zealand cricket star, is set to make a comeback to the sport after a four-year retirement. He will be representing Samoa, his mother's native country, in the upcoming Twenty20 World Cup qualifying series. Taylor aims to contribute his extensive experience to the team and help Samoa secure a spot in the 2026 World Cup.

title: Breetzke leads South Africa to narrow win over England to seal series
description: The combined 655 runs scored was the most ever in an ODI at Lord's but that was scant consolation for England

title: US Open 2025: Bhambri's dream run ends in semis
description: Joe Salisbury and Neal Skupski of Britain triumphed over India's Yuki Bhambri and Michael Venus in a thrilling US Open semifinal. After dropping the first set, the British pair rallied to win 6(2)-7, 7-6(5), 6-4. Bhambri and Venus, despite a strong tournament run including impressive victories, couldn't maintain their early lead.

title: 'We’re having good dialogue': Trump says he'll speak with Putin; admits Ukraine war hard to resolve
description: US president Trump announced plans to speak with Vladimir Putin soon, following discussions with Volodymyr Zelensky and European leaders. This comes amidst ongoing Russian attacks on Ukraine and Putin's strengthened ties with China and India. Trump and Putin last met in August, focusing on the war in Ukraine, but failed to reach a ceasefire agreement.

title: Russell Wilson’s surname legally adopted by Ciara’s son with rapper Future
description: Ciara has legally added her husband Russell Wilson's last name to her eldest son, Future Zahir's, name, reflecting Russell's significant role as a stepfather. This decision, years in the making, symbolizes the couple's commitment to their blended family. Russell's philosophy of loving all children equally resonates with their united and supportive family dynamic.

title: WH pushes 'warrior ethos': Trump revives 'dept of war'; Hegseth gets new title
description: Donald Trump has renamed the US department of defence to the department of war. The White House stated that Trump will sign an executive order. This permits the use of the new title as a secondary name. Pete Hegseth will be known as the secretary of war. Pentagon websites and signage will also be updated. Trump mentioned the history of victory associated with the department of war.

'Not that high': Donald Trump vows 'fairly substantial' chip tariffs soon
description: President Trump declared the imminent imposition of a "fairly substantial tariff" on imported computer chips during a White House dinner with tech executives. This announcement follows previous threats, including a potential 100% tariff on semiconductors from companies not investing in the US. The move comes amid a US-China trade war and competition in high-end semiconductor development, while Trump seeks a Supreme Court ruling on broader tariff legality.

description: ‘Param Sundari,’ starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor, earned ₹39.85 crore in its first week. The film saw a dip in collections during weekdays after a strong opening weekend. Facing competition from new releases like ‘Baaghi 4’ and ‘The Bengal Files,’ its box office performance in the coming days will be crucial.

title: Govt revamps GST: Rates reduced on nearly 400 goods — Here’s how cuts will reach consumers by Sept 22
description: Following the government's GST rate reductions on numerous goods and services, Indian companies are adjusting prices to benefit consumers by September 22. FMCG firms may increase product quantity for fixed-price items. White goods companies anticipate a demand surge, while hotels offer reduced rates for check-in payments. Car dealers, however, face potential losses due to existing inventory and revised cess structures.

description: IPL tickets have been classified in the ‘Luxury Goods’ category and would attract 40% GST

title: School must go on, so farmer in Rajasthan moves out of home with family
description: In a heartwarming act of selflessness, farmhand Mor Singh offered his home to 50 students in Rajasthan's Piplodi after their school collapsed, killing seven. Singh and his family now live in a makeshift shack, prioritizing the children's education.

title: GST reforms 'Diwali Dhamaka', meant to better lives, says PM
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the GST reforms as a "Diwali Dhamaka," emphasizing their role in simplifying the tax system, improving citizens' lives, and boosting economic growth. He criticized the previous Congress regime for high taxes on essential goods, highlighting the current government's focus on savings for common people.

title: Rate cut will help neutralise adverse impact of US tariffs: Goyal
description: Piyush Goyal announced that GST reductions will stimulate domestic demand, offsetting US tariffs' impact. The government is collaborating with 50 nations on complementary products and exploring export opportunities in the UAE, Singapore, and Africa. An Export Promotion Mission is awaiting Union Cabinet approval, with ongoing efforts to decriminalize laws and boost domestic consumption.

title: Battered North India logs its rainiest 2-week period in 14 years
description: North India experienced unprecedented rainfall between August 22 and September 4, with nearly three times the normal amount. This intense spell, the wettest in at least 14 years, triggered devastating floods in Punjab, record Yamuna levels in Delhi, and landslides in the Himalayas.

title: Arrested TMC MLA used Gramin Bank accounts to launder scam money, says ED
Researchers develop performance metrics to test traffic control algorithms
description: The framework developed by researchers from IIT-Bombay and Australia’s Monash University will allow rapid evaluation of traffic policies using fewer computational resources to help design smarter, safer urban traffic systems

title: WAPCOS chair removed over ‘irregularities’
India, Singapore plan strategic partnership
description: India and Singapore have unveiled a comprehensive strategic partnership roadmap to enhance collaboration across various sectors, including economic cooperation, skill development, and digitalization. The agreement, announced during PM Modi's talks with Singaporean PM Lawrence Wong, focuses on strengthening ties beyond traditional areas, with an emphasis on advanced manufacturing, green shipping, and civil nuclear energy.

title: Kuki groups agree to renew suspension of ops; open key Manipur NH
description: Ahead of PM Modi's Manipur visit, significant peace deals have been finalized. The Kuki-Zo Council agreed to open National Highway 2, while Kuki militant groups renewed their suspension of operations, affirming Manipur's territorial integrity. This agreement hints at future political dialogue for a settlement under the Constitution. The Kuki groups will deposit arms and delist foreign nationals.

title: Fifty years ago | International Music Day on Oct 1
Centre to keep watch to ensure lower prices follow GST revamp
description: The government is closely monitoring price changes following GST reductions on nearly 400 items, expecting industries to pass on benefits to consumers starting September 22. Indirect tax authorities are collecting current prices for comparison, and NDA MPs are tasked with ensuring companies don't pocket the gains.

Revised Suspension of Operations pact tightens norms for Kuki-Zo groups
description: The revised pact, valid for a year, says stipend will be paid only through Aadhaar-linked bank accounts to those members who are present in the camps during inspection. Photo identity cards shall be provided by the Manipur Police, it says; agreement to be followed by a ‘tripartite dialogue for a negotiated political settlement under Constitution of India’

title: Amid allies' JPC boycott, Congress drags feet on nominations
description: Despite government efforts to engage Congress in nominating members for the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) on bills concerning the dismissal of jailed ministers and chief ministers, Congress has yet to respond. This delay reflects potential pressure on the party due to boycotts from key allies.

title: Pawan Khera's wife gets ERO notice for registering as voter in 2 seats
description: Kota Neelima, wife of Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera, faces an Election Commission notice for dual voter registration in New Delhi and Telangana, a violation of the Representation of the People Act. This follows a similar notice issued to Khera, who has since applied to remove his name from Delhi's Jangpura electoral roll after BJP flagged the duplicate enrollments.

title: Was Sonia voter before she was citizen? Court to hear plea for FIR
description: A Delhi court has scheduled a hearing for September 10 regarding a criminal complaint against Sonia Gandhi. The complaint alleges that her name appeared on electoral rolls before she became an Indian citizen in 1983. The petition claims this violated the Representation of the People Act, as non-citizens are ineligible to register as voters.

title: SIR-NRC panic in West Bengal drives mad rush for documents
description: A wave of panic has gripped Murshidabad, Bengal, as residents rush to digitize birth certificates amid fears of a Bihar-style voter roll revision and a potential NRC. This surge, fueled by rumors and social media, has overwhelmed local municipality offices, with applications increasing tenfold.

title: Reddy seeks support from Bihar, says INDIA bloc represents 63% population
description: Mr. Reddy said the “post of Vice-President is not limited to being the Chairman of the Rajya Sabha, but it is a symbol of democratic dignity and constitutional balance.”

title: Ex-cop rescued as wife gets abductors to share location
description: A retired Punjab police officer, Darshan Singh, was kidnapped in Bareilly. His wife cleverly secured the kidnappers' location by sending ransom money via UPI. She then alerted the police. Bareilly police rescued Singh and arrested two suspects, Akash Kumar and Virendra Pal. Four other suspects are still on the run. Police seized a motorcycle used in the crime.

description: Taking suo motu cognizance of a media report highlighting custodial deaths in Rajasthan, the Supreme Court has decided to examine the implementation of its 2020 order mandating CCTV installation in police stations.

description: Arvind Kejriwal surveyed flood-affected Sultanpur Lodhi, praising the resilience of Punjabis amidst the crisis. His visit follows criticism of the Mann government's handling of the situation. Simultaneously, Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan assessed damaged crops in Amritsar and Gurdaspur, assuring central assistance to farmers.

title: PM Modi, EU leaders discuss early conclusion of FTA
description: PM Modi engaged with EU leaders, emphasizing trade, technology, and defense cooperation, pushing for a swift conclusion to the India-EU FTA negotiations by year-end. EU leaders echoed this commitment, planning a joint strategic agenda for the 2026 summit. Discussions also covered the Ukraine conflict, with the EU urging India to leverage its influence for peaceful resolution and stability.

title: Supreme Court to probe green norms violation in Himalayan region
description: The Supreme Court is set to investigate the alleged environmental violations in Himalayan development projects, suspected of causing recent devastating floods and landslides. The court issued notices to multiple government bodies and states, expressing concern over illegal deforestation. The PIL seeks an SIT to determine the causes of these disasters and suggest protective measures for the Himalayan ecology.

title: NGO calls for better public warning system on heat; study finds deadly heat levels at TVK conference in Madurai
IIT-Madras & IISc-Bengaluru maintain NIRF dominance
description: IIT-Madras has secured the top position in the NIRF 2025 "overall" category for the seventh consecutive year, while IISc-Bengaluru remains India's best university for the tenth year. Manipal Academy of Higher Education entered the top three in the university category for the first time. Delhi University colleges dominated the colleges list, with Hindu College at No. 1.

title: Should commercial speech on digital platforms be regulated?
description: It is a slippery slope to suggest speech may be curtailed on the basis of a somewhat amorphous concept such as dignity

title: Sri Lanka rights body says mass grave likely result of extrajudicial killings
description: “There is a reasonable likelihood that the burials were unlawful and pursuant to extrajudicial killings,” said HRCSL in a report issued on Wednesday following their visit to the site on August 3 and 4

title: Who is Amari Cooper dating? Inside the life of his girlfriend Destiny Jones
description: Rumors swirl around Las Vegas Raiders' Amari Cooper's long-term relationship with Destiny Jones, a therapist with a background in dance and community service. Their connection, possibly dating back to Cooper's draft in 2015, has been intentionally private. Despite Cooper's high-profile NFL career, the couple has avoided public announcements, fueling fan speculation about their enduring bond.

Rural India's total fertility rate dips to replacement rate
description: India's Total Fertility Rate (TFR) has declined to 1.9 in 2023, below the replacement level of 2.1, while rural India's TFR reached the replacement rate for the first time. Bihar recorded the highest TFR at 2.8, and Delhi had the lowest at 1.2. The Gross Reproduction Rate (GRR) for India is estimated at 0.

title: A Hardy mentor, in letter and spirit
description: An English mathematician of repute, Godfrey Harold Hardy is known for his work in number theory and mathematical analysis. For Indians, though, Hardy will always be the mentor who plucked Srinivasa Ramanujan from relative obscurity and placed him in the echelons of mathematical greats. A look at the life and work of Hardy, and his relationship with Ramanujan…

title: Trump’s personal rapport with Modi is gone: Former US NSA
description: John Bolton claims the once-strong personal relationship between Donald Trump and Narendra Modi has deteriorated, signaling a potential shift in US-India relations. Bolton warns world leaders that personal ties with Trump won't guarantee protection from his unpredictable foreign policy decisions. This revelation comes amid growing tensions between the two nations, fueled by trade disputes and shifting geopolitical priorities.

title: T.N. government sanctions ₹2,126 crore for extension of metro rail from Poonamallee to Sunguvarchatram

title: 'You can’t talk to India, China like that': Putin hits back at Trump's tariff
description: Vladimir Putin has cautioned the United States against using tariffs and sanctions to pressure India and China, emphasizing that the colonial era is over and such tactics are inappropriate. He accused the Trump administration of attempting to weaken the leadership of these nations through economic pressure, noting their historical sensitivities and strong domestic political systems.

The analog optical computer, developed by Microsoft Research, uses light for calculations instead of electricity. It promises to solve complex problems 100 times faster and with 100 times less energy, potentially revolutionizing fields like finance, healthcare, and AI.

Trump expressed hope Musk would rejoin the GOP, dismissing the "radical left lunatics." This follows a fallout sparked by Musk's criticism of Trump's tax bill. Despite earlier threats, Trump now wishes Musk well.

title: Gretzky and Canada’s identity: Why he no longer defines hockey
description: Wayne Gretzky, once the undisputed symbol of Canadian hockey, is now being re-evaluated as the sport evolves. While his legacy remains significant, the rise of international stars and Canada's changing role in the global game have sparked an identity crisis. Canadians are urged to embrace a future where their hockey identity extends beyond a single figure.

title: After paralysis, Reese Ketler hears a doctor’s unexpected message
description: In 2019, Reese Ketler's hockey career ended abruptly due to a spinal cord injury. Doctors initially feared he might never walk again. Through intensive rehab and unwavering determination, Ketler defied expectations and returned home early. Now, he inspires thousands as a content creator, proving life continues after tragedy and sharing a message of hope and resilience.

title: Deion Sanders gives heartfelt fatherhood advice to Jaguars rookie Hunter
description: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.

title: Amazon's cost-cutting rule: New phone policy; Staff must report personal usage
description: Amazon is now requiring employees to meticulously report the percentage of work-related usage on their company-issued phones. This is to adjust their $50 monthly reimbursements proportionally, based on personal use. This phone monitoring is part of CEO Andy Jassy's "hardcore culture reset" and cost-cutting measures, leading to employee frustration and anxiety about job security.
